data.name: Glittering Street
data.description: An urban area filled with goods and wares, from strange and precious treasures to everyday items, recreating the bustle of Liyue's markets.\n"Glittering" here is no overstatement, for Liyue is the place where all ships go and all stocks flow. As such, the vast majority of its citizens do not want for necessities. But if something is indeed lacking, you can wait for the end of the month to send feedback to the purple-haired young woman who often roams the markets during that time. Her true identity is unclear, but what is known is that most goods brought to her attention will soon appear on the markets.

text.text: This place captures the atmosphere, yet avoids such disturbances and clamor as are common to the city.
Your design for this street is most exquisite.
A stroll here will certainly serve as inspiration for my writing!
I have observed Liyue from the Jade Chamber for years â€” every building and every tile is etched into my memory.
I cannot sense the slightest feeling of discord from this street... It is quite a rare find indeed.
Your ability never ceases to surprise me...
The flourishing city of Liyue developed from small streets dotted with a few shops, just like this one.
You have a talent for many pursuits, as well as a boldness of spirit.
To me, each day spent with you is as valuable as gold.
As I thought, you've carefully observed the streets of Liyue.
Your understanding of the layout of stores and vendors is most detailed.
Would you be interested in discussing plans to improve Chihu Rock with me?
You wouldn't see any operational mistakes in this commercial area even during a busy festival season.
I can tell that you've put a great deal of time into this.
Do you plan to attract more shops? I can provide you with legal support.
If we were in Liyue Harbor, this street would be crammed with people... and I don't think I'd stay longer than I needed to.
But here, this street seems like such a safe place...
Join me for a walk. It could be good practice for you, helping me acclimatize to the mortal world.
I always love to take a stroll around the night market after a performance.
This street has a striking resemblance to those back in Liyue. It really feels just like being there.
Let's take a stroll around here tonight, then. What do you say?
